subject: Re: [junit] DOubt in installation
msgSnippet: Bad shot ! :) Ajith is mixing the JUnit framework with the Cactus framework and posting on the wrong forums ... -Vincent ... From: Menarek John-NJM010
messageBody:
Bad shot ! :)
Ajith is mixing the JUnit framework with the Cactus framework and posting on
the wrong forums ...
-Vincent

----- Original Message -----
From: "Menarek John-NJM010" <John_Menarek-NJM010@...>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Friday, August 24, 2001 4:03 PM
Subject: RE: [junit] DOubt in installation


> Are you trying to use the gui interface if so try the textui first.
>
> A shot from the hip is it looks like junit wants a resource bundle for the
U.S. but maybe your
> set up for the U.K.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Ajith Ittan [mailto:ajith_ittan@...]
> Sent: Friday, August 24, 2001 9:58 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] DOubt in installation
>
>
> Hi All,
> I am getting this exception can neone please give me
> the solution to this!!
> java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError:
> java.util.MissingResourceException: Can't find
> resource for base name cactus, locale en_US
> at
> java.util.ResourceBundle.getBundle(ResourceBundle.java:423)
> at
> java.util.ResourceBundle.getBundle(ResourceBundle.java:339)
> at
>
org.apache.commons.cactus.client.AbstractHttpClient.<clinit>(AbstractHttpCli
ent.java:82)
> at
>
org.apache.commons.cactus.AbstractTestCase.runBare(AbstractTestCase.java:281
)
>
> please revert back at the earliest.
> Thanks & Regards
> Ajith Ittan
>
